article.title: A Storm of Swords (Song of Ice and Fire)
article.description: Book: 'The third volume of Martin's beloved fantasy saga that includes 'A Game of Thrones' and 'A Clash of Kings' continues the story of the battle for control over the Seven Kingdoms, as wars rage on and alliances are made and broken.'

article.title: Asus LED monitor VS247HR
article.description: Asus LED monitor VS247HR z dimenzijo zaslona 23,6 inches , z ločljivostjo 1920×1080, priključki D-Sub (VGA), DVI-D, HDMI, možnost stenske montaže, vidni kot znaša 170°/160°, kontrast 50000000:1 ASUS Smart Contrast Ratio, svetilnost 250 cd/m2…

article.title: Diamondback Century 1 Road Bike (700c Wheels)
article.description: Built for comfort on the roads, the Diamondback® Century 1 bike features all the technology and smooth handling of the Podium series, but with a slightly more upright geometry that puts less strain on your neck and back. The Shimano® drivetrain and FSA® Tempo Triple crankset spins smoothly through the 24 gears, operated with Shimano® dual-control shifters/brakes. Michelin® Dynamic Sport 700c tires deliver a comfortable ride.

article.title: The Great Gatsby
article.description: The exemplary novel of the Jazz Age, F. Scott Fitzgeralds third book, The Great Gatsby (1925), stands as the supreme achievement of his career. T. S. Eliot read it three times and saw it as the 'first step' American fiction had taken since Henry James; H. L. Mencken praised 'the charm and beauty of the writing,' as well as Fitzgeralds sharp social sense; and Thomas Wolfe hailed it as Fitzgeralds 'best work' thus far. The story of the fabulously wealthy Jay Gatsby and his love for the beautiful Daisy Buchanan, of lavish parties on Long Island at a time when, The New York Times remarked, 'gin was the national drink and sex the national obsession,'' it is an exquisitely crafted tale of America in the 1920s that resonates with the power of myth. A novel of lyrical beauty yet brutal realism, of magic, romance, and mysticism, The Great Gatsby is one of the great classics of twentieth-century literature.
